We would like to congratulate Mark Williams for being selected as a new Paris High School - KY Math Teacher!

I am originally from Scottsville, Kentucky. I am a graduate of Western Kentucky University. I completed my graduate degree at Morehead state University. I began teaching in 1982. I came to Paris Independent schools in 1988, where I taught middle school for six years. In 1994 I began teaching at Paris High school and remained there until 2008. I finished my 30-year teaching career at Lincoln County in 2012. I worked as a high school math tutor for 4 years at Madison Southern High School. Then, I worked in the computer lab in credit recovery at Madison Southern High School. In the last two years I have been working as an Associate Resource Manager for the Kroger Corporation.

Paris High School Athletics is pleased to present Coach George Baker as the next high school basketball coach.

Coach Baker coached junior professional team while in Portugal, was an assistant coach for the Bluegrass Stallions, was the owner and operator and head coach of Prodigy Basketball Academy from 2013-2016, and has trained over 400 young men and women, many who have gone on to successful high school, college, and professional careers.

During his playing career, he was a two-time all-state selection at Paul Dunbar including Kentucky Mr. Basketball runner up 1999, 1st team all American at Georgetown College, New Zealand all-league selection and, Portuguese All Star and player of the year.

Coach Baker is excited about joining the Paris community and leading the historic Greyhound program. Please join Paris High School Athletics in welcoming Coach George Baker.

Financial Resource Series 2 of 5 - Making a Plan!

(Paris FRYSC is providing this information as a resource for families. The information provided is from the sources cited and is not a financial recommendation from Paris FRYSC.)

Senator Elizabeth Warren's 50/30/20 rule can help you make a plan. Senator Warren recommends dividing your income and spending 50% on Needs (housing, food, clothing and minimum payments on debts), 30% on Wants (unlimited phone services, cable/satellite, entertainment, etc.), and Saving 20%. Saving allows you to accumulate an emergency fund to cover unexpected expenses such as car repairs, medical costs, job loss, or additional payments on debts. You can set up a savings account at any local bank.
(There are many other plan options out there, look at what will work for your family and make it happen.)

(Source: thebalance.com)
